title: Check for a Balanced Equation
text: Check if the equation is balanced or not. If not, balance the equation.

title: Calculate the Molar Amount of $$CuSO_4$$
text: Use the equation Moles of Reactant A $$=$$ Mass of Reactant A * (Moles of Reactant A)/(Molar Mass of Reactant A).

title: Calculate the Molar Amount of $$CuSO_4$$
text: What is $$(1.274$$ g CuSO_4)*(1 mol $$CuSO_4$$ / $$159.62$$ g CuSO_4)? Keep three decimal places.

title: Identify the Stoichiometric Factor
text: The stoichiometric factor relating the two substances of interest is $$1$$ mol Cu / $$1$$ mol $$CuSO_4$$.

title: Calculate the Molar Amount of Cu
text: The molar amount of Cu is derived by multiplying the provided molar amount of $$CuSO_4$$ by multiplying the stoichiometric factor.

title: Calculate the Molar Amount of Cu
text: What is $$(0.008$$ mol CuSO_4)*(1 mol Cu / $$1$$ mol CuSO_)? Keep three decimal places.

title: Calculate the Mass of Cu
text: Calculate the Mass of Cu with Mass of Reactant A $$=$$ (Molar Mass of Reactant A)/(Moles of Reactant A)*Moles of Reactant A)

title: Calculate the Mass of Cu
text: What is $$(0.008$$ mol Cu)*(63.55 g Cu)/(mol Cu)? Keep three decimal places.

title: Calculate the Percentage Yield
text: Calculate the percentage yield with $$___$$ % yield $$=$$ (Experimental (actual) yield of product C)/(Theoretical (calculated) yield of product C)*100.

title: Calculate the Percentage Yield
text: What is $$0.392$$ g Cu /0.508 g Cu? Give your answer as an integer.
